member.name: T:Aspose.Chart.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
1. Explicit path.
2. The folder of the component assembly.
3. The folder of the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder of the entry assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
1. Explicit path.
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic") Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: T:Aspose.Chart.ChartType
member.summary: Defines chart types supported by Aspose.Chart.

remarks.p: To specify a chart type, set the Series.ChartType property.
All of the chart types require data points with one Y value, unless specified otherwise.

member.name: F:Aspose.Chart.ChartType.Area
member.summary: Area chart.

member.name: F:Aspose.Chart.ChartType.Bar
member.summary: Bar chart.

summary.p: Data points on this chart use two Y values. The first Y value is the position of the bubble along the Y axis; the second Y value is the diameter of the bubble in pixels.
The number of Y values is variable, but must be the same for all data points in a series. The Y values form the contour "heights" like on a topographic map.
Data points on this chart use four 4 values: Open, High, Low, Close in that order.

member.name: F:Aspose.Chart.ChartType.Cube
member.summary: Cube chart.

member.name: F:Aspose.Chart.ChartType.Curve
member.summary: Curve chart.

member.name: F:Aspose.Chart.ChartType.CurveArea
member.summary: Curve Area chart.

member.name: F:Aspose.Chart.ChartType.Doughnut
member.summary: Doughnut chart.

summary.p: Data points on this chart use 2 values: the first value is the start of the bar and the second value is the end of the bar along the Y axis.
Data points on this chart use four 4 values: Open, High, Low, Close in that order.

member.name: F:Aspose.Chart.ChartType.Line
member.summary: Line chart.

summary.p: Data points on this chart use four 4 values: Open, High, Low, Close in that order.

member.summary: Pareto chart.

member.summary: Pie chart.

member.summary: Pyramid chart.

member.summary: Point chart.

member.name: F:Aspose.Chart.ChartType.Radar
member.summary: Radar chart.

member.name: F:Aspose.Chart.ChartType.Scatter
member.summary: Scatter chart.

member.name: F:Aspose.Chart.ChartType.Step
member.summary: Step chart.

summary.p: The number of Y values is variable, but must be the same for all data points in a series. The Y values form the surface heights like on a topographic map.

member.name: T:Aspose.Chart.Axis
member.summary: Represents a chart axis.

remarks.p: The Axis class provides properties that allow you to modify various aspects of a chart axis such as labels, grid, tick marks, minimum, maximum etc.
Axes of a chart are created automatically and you can access them via the AxisX, AxisY, AxisX2, AxisY2 properties of the object. You do not need to create Axis objects directly.

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.Axis.GetPosition(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets position by the value.
member.param: The value of axis

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.Point1
member.summary: Position of axis start

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.Point1Offset
member.summary: Offset from the default position of axis start

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.Point2
member.summary: Position of axis end

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.Point2Offset
member.summary: Offset from the default position of axis end

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.MajorGrid
member.summary: Gets the object that represents the major grid of the chart.

remarks.p: The lines of the major grid are drawn for each data label on the axis.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.IsMajorGridVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the major grid is visible.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.MinorGrid
member.summary: Gets the object that represents the minor grid of the chart.

remarks.p: The lines of the minor grid are drawn between the data labels on the axis.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.IsMinorGridVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the minor grid is visible.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.MajorTickMark
member.summary: Gets the object that represents the major tick marks on the axis.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.MinorTickMark
member.summary: Gets the object that represents the minor tick marks on the axis.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.Interval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval between the labels along the axis for normal axis scale ( = ScaleType.Normal ) .

remarks.p: The Interval property has effect only when is set to false and is set to ScaleType.Normal.

The effect of the Interval property depends on the interval type specified in . For example, if IntervalType is integer and Interval is 10, then the labels on the axis will appear for values 0, 10, 20 and so on.
The default value is 1.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.Maximum
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value of the axis.

remarks.p: Setting the Maximum property only has effect when is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.Minimum
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value of the axis.

remarks.p: Setting the Minimum property only has effect when is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.Arrow1
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the arrow drawn at the left or top end of the axis.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.Arrow2
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the arrow drawn at the right or bottom end of the axis.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.Title
member.summary: Provides access to the object that represents the title of the axis.

remarks.p: The axis title is drawn near the axis.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.DefaultLabel
member.summary: Provides access to the object that serves as a template for axis data labels.

remarks.p: By setting properties of the default label before adding any series to the chart, you can control the look of all data labels that will be generated for the axis.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.AxisLabels
member.summary: Provides access to the collection of automatically generated axis data labels.

remarks.p: The AxisLabels collection is automatically populated when the chart is drawn.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.CustomLabels
member.summary: Provides access to the collection of custom (user specified) axis labels.

remarks.p: Use the CustomLabels property to add your own labels to the axis.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.IsAutoCalc
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the axis minimum, maximum and interval for labels are calculated automatically.

remarks.p: When true, the system tries to calculate the axis properties automatically to achieve the best scaling and label placement. When false, the system uses the values specified in the , and properties.
The default value is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.IntervalType
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval type.

remarks.p: The IntervalType property specifies the data type of the values output along the axis.

The default value is IntervalType.Auto and the system tries to automatically determine the appropriate interval type from the data points, but it is possible to explicitly specify the interval type by setting the IntervalType property.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.DateTimeIntervalType
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval type when the axis displays DateTime values.

remarks.p: DateTimeIntervalType has effect only when the axis values are DateTime values.

The DateTimeIntervalType property is usually used in conjunction with the property. For example, to specify the labels to appear for every 2nd day, set DateTimeIntervalType to DateTimeIntervalType.Days and set Interval to 2.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the axis line.

remarks.p: The default value is Color.Black.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the axis line.

remarks.p: The default value is 1 pixel.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the style of the axis line.

remarks.p: The default style is DashStyle.Solid.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.IsVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this axis is visible.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.ChartArea
member.summary: Gets the chart area this axis belongs to.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.ScaleType
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale type of this axis.

remarks.p: The default value is ScaleType.Normal.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.LogarithmicBase
member.summary: Gets or sets the logarithmic base of logarithmic axis scales. Used only in conjunction with Logarithmic Scales.

remarks.p: The default value is 10.
The value must be more 1.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.Axis.IntervalLogarithmic
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval between the labels along the axis for logarithmic axis scale ( = ScaleType.Logarithmic ).

remarks.p: The Interval property has effect only when is set to false and is set to ScaleType.Logarithmic.

member.name: T:Aspose.Chart.AxisLabel
member.summary: Represents a label on a chart axis.

remarks.p: The AxisLabel class provides properties that allow you to customize the look of various labels on an axis of a chart.
The Axis.DefaultLabel property is used as a template to generate axis labels that fill the Axis.AxisLabels collection when the chart is drawn.
You can create AxisLabel objects and add them to the collection of custom labels Axis.CustomLabels.

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.AxisLabel.#ctor(System.String,System.Drawing.Font,System.Drawing.Color,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a custom label.
member.param: The text of the label.
The font of the label text.
The color of the label text.
The "from" value on the axis where the label is attached to.
The "to" value on the axis where the label is attached to.

remarks.p: After creating an AxisLabel object and setting its properties you can add it to the Axis.CustomLabels collection.

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.AxisLabel.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a custom label.

remarks.p: After creating an AxisLabel object and setting its properties you can add it to the Axis.CustomLabels collection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.AxisLabel.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the label text.

remarks.p: The default value is Color.Black.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.AxisLabel.Font
member.summary: Gets or sets the font of the label text.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.AxisLabel.CustomLabelGridWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets value indicating the grid width of custom label.

member.summary: Gets or sets value indicating whether the label is visible.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.AxisLabel.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text of the label.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.AxisLabel.FromValue
member.summary: Specifies where the custom label is "connected" to the axis.

remarks.p: This property has effect only for a custom label.
When the FromValue and ToValue properties are set, a custom label is drawn with a bracket showing that the label applies to a range of values on the axis.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.AxisLabel.ToValue
member.summary: Specifies where the custom label is "connected" to the axis.

remarks.p: This property has effect only for a custom label.
When the FromValue and ToValue properties are set, a custom label is drawn with a bracket showing that the label applies to a range of values on the axis.

member.summary: Gets the value on the axis along which the label is drawn.

remarks.p: This property is only applicable for automatically generated axis labels.

member.summary: Gets or sets the angle of the label text.
member.remarks: The value can be from -90 to 90 degrees.

member.summary: Gets or sets the format string of the label text.
member.remarks: The format string complies with Formatting Types in the .NET Framework.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a marker of a custom label is drawn on the chart.

member.name: T:Aspose.Chart.ChartArea
member.summary: Represents a rectangular area with a single chart drawing.

remarks.p: ChartArea provides properties that allow to specify axes, background color and/or gradient, legend box, chart palette etc.
If you need only one chart drawing in your chart, use the Chart.ChartArea property to specify settings for the chart drawing.

Aspose.Chart allows to create charts that contain multiple chart drawings. If you need to create a chart with multiple chart drawings, create ChartArea objects and add them to the Chart.CharAreas collection.

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.ChartArea.#ctor(Aspose.Chart.Chart)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.param: The parent object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.ChartArea.AxisAreaPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the axis area on the chart in pixels.
member.remarks: It is not meaningful for 3D charts and Contour, Doughnut, Pie, Pyramid, Radar, Surface chart types. Set AxisAreaPosition = RectangleF.Empty for automatic calculation of axis area. The default value is RectangleF.Empty.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.ChartArea.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the chart area.

remarks.p: The name of the chart area can be used in charts with multiple chart areas to specify which data series are displayed on which chart areas.

member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the chart area.

remarks.p: The primary X axis is normally displayed at the bottom of the chart area.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.ChartArea.AxisX2
member.summary: Returns an object that represents the secondary X axis of the chart area.

remarks.p: The secondary X axis is optional (invisible by default) and can be displayed at the top of the chart area.

remarks.p: The primary Y axis is normally displayed on the left of the chart area.

member.summary: Returns an object that represents the secondary Y axis of the chart area.

remarks.p: The secondary Y axis is optional (invisible by default) and can be displayed on the right of the chart area.

member.name: T:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes
member.summary: Represents custom attributes valid for specific chart types.

remarks.p: The CustomAttributes object allows to specify various options for drawing a chart. Note that some properties of CustomAttributes are applicable only to certain chart types. For example, is only applicable for Pie and Doughnut charts.

The and classes expose custom attributes via the Series.CustomAttributes and DataPoint.CustomAttributes properties. Modifying CustomAttributes for a Series has effect on the whole series, but modifying CustomAttributes of a DataPoint affects only that particular data point.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes.StarMarkerRaysCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rays in a star point marker.

remarks.p: Valid for Line, Point and Step charts only.
The value must be more 1. The default value is 5.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes.GanttHeightRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the relative height of the bars in a Gantt chart.

remarks.p: Valid for Gantt charts only.
The value must be between 0.0 and 1.0. The default value is 2/3.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes.BarWidthRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the relative width of bars in a bar chart.

remarks.p: Valid for Bar, HighLowClose and OpenHighLowClose charts only.
The value can be between 0.0 and 1.0. The default value is 2/3.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes.BarOverlap
member.summary: Specifies how bars are positioned. Can be a value between -100 and 100.

remarks.p: Now applies only to 2-D bar charts.
The value can be between -100 and 100 The default value is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes.BarWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the absolute width of bars in a bar chart.

remarks.p: Valid for Bar charts only.
Value can be more 0 or is equal float.NaN.
The bars width is calculated on basis BarWidthRate when value is equal float.NaN.
The default value float.NaN.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes.PointSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of a data point in pixels.

remarks.p: Valid for Cube, Line, Pareto, Point, Radar and Scatter charts only.
The default value is 6.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes.PointMarker
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the data point marker.

remarks.p: Valid for Line, Pareto, Point, Radar and Scatter charts only.
The default value is MarkerType.Circle.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes.IsExploded
member.summary: Specifies whether a particular data point on of a Pie or Doughnut chart is exploded.

remarks.p: Valid for Pie and Doughnut charts only.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes.IsAllExploded
member.summary: Specifies whether the whole Pie or Doughnut chart is exploded.

remarks.p: Valid for Pie and Doughnut charts only.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes.ExplodedWidthRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the relative width by which the Pie or Doughnut chart is exploded.

remarks.p: Valid for Pie and Doughnut charts only.
The value can be between 0.0 and 1.0. The default value is 0.1.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes.IsWithLabelMark
member.summary: True to make a data point to display text specified in DataPoint.LabelText.

remarks.p: Valid for Pie and Doughnut charts when is true
The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes.DoughnutRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets the relative inner radius of a Doughnut chart.

remarks.p: Valid for Doughnut charts only.
The value can be between 0.0 and 1.0. The default value is 2/3.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes.RadialLineSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of a radial line (in pixels) connecting the data point label with a pie or doughnut chart.

remarks.p: Valid for Pie and Doughnut charts only.
The default value is -1.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes.HorizontalLineSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of a horizontal line (in pixels) connecting the data point label with a Pie or Doughnut chart.

remarks.p: Valid for Pie and Doughnut charts only.
The default value is -1.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes.CurveTension
member.summary: Gets or sets the curve tension.

remarks.p: Valid for Curve and CurveArea charts only.
The default value is 0.5F.

remarks.p: Valid for Bubble charts only.
The default value is BubbleSizeRepresentsType.SizeIsArea.

member.summary: Gets or sets diameter of the minimum bubble in pixels.

remarks.p: Valid for Bubble charts only.
The default value is variable with the change in chart area size

remarks.p: Valid for Bubble charts only.
The default value is variable with the change in chart area size

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes.BubbleSize

member.summary: Specifies whether the series on an Area chart with multiple series are stacked and take 100% of the chart height.
member.remarks: Valid for Area charts with multiple series only. The default value is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates the Pyramid chart is shaded to look like it is a cone.

member.summary: Specifies whether the grid for a Contour or Surface chart is visible.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.CustomAttributes.NegativeBarColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the bars for negative days on financial charts.

remarks.p: Valid for OpenHighLowClose, HighLowClose and Candlestick charts only. The default value is Color.Empty.

When NegativeBarColor is specified, it is used for periods where the closing price is lower than the opening price. For periods where the closing price is higher than the opening price, DataPoint.Color is used.

member.remarks: Valid for Pie or Doughnut charts only. The default value is PieLabelType.Side.

remarks.p: Valid for Area charts with multiple series only. The default value is false.

The default value float.NaN.
The height is calculated automatically when value is equal float.NaN. remarks>

Whether the space surrounded pie is empty
///
Valid for Pie and Doughnut charts only.
The default value is false.
If sets the value to true, RadialLineSize and HorizontalLineSize are valid, always zero.

Whether drawing background of radar chart.Applies only to radar chart
///
Valid for Radar chart only.
The default value is true.
If sets the value to false, no background

member.name: T:Aspose.Chart.DataPoint
member.summary: Represents one data point on a chart.

remarks.p: A DataPoint has one X value and one or more Y values. The X and Y values specify where on the chart the data point is drawn. The way the data point is drawn depends on the type of the chart specified by the Series.ChartType property.
Some types of charts require several Y values to draw properly, for example each data point on an OpenHighLowClose chart needs to have 4 Y values: Open, High, Low and Close values.
Data points are stored in a collection in the Series.DataPoints property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Y value(s) of the data point.

member.name: P:Aspose.Chart.DataPoint.Url
member.summary: Gets or sets the destination url of a clickable data point.

remarks.p: Note that only Bar, Pie and Doughnut charts support clickable data points and only in charts saved in the Macromedia Flash format using the Chart.SaveToSwf method.
The url can be in absolute or relative format. For example, "http://www.aspose.com/mypage.html" and "mypage.html" are valid urls.

member.name: T:Aspose.Chart.Series
member.summary: Represents a data series on a chart.

remarks.p: Data series is a set of related data points plotted on a chart.

Typically, each data series in a chart has a unique color and is represented in the legend box. You can plot one or more data series on a chart by creating Series objects and adding them to Chart.SeriesCollection.

To specify how a data series is plotted on the chart, use the property. A single chart can combine different chart types. For example, ChartType.Bar and ChartType.Line series can be combined in one chart.
To populate a series, create objects and add them to the collection or use the DataPoints.DataBindXY and DataPoints.DataBindY methods.

member.name: T:Aspose.Chart.Chart
member.summary: The root object to create a chart.

remarks.p: Most of the time one chart contains a single chart drawing, but Aspose.Chart allows to have more than one chart drawing in a single chart. One chart drawing is represented by the class. The whole chart that can contain multiple drawings is represented by the Chart class.
If you need only one ChartArea in your chart, use the Chart.ChartArea property to specify settings for the chart drawing.
If you need to create a chart with multiple chart drawings, create ChartArea objects and add them to the collection.
After instantiating a Chart object and specifying ChartArea properties, create one or more filled objects and add them to the .

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.Chart.Save(System.String)
member.overloads: Creates the chart image and saves it.
member.summary: Creates the chart image and saves it to a file.
member.param: The image file name with full path.

remarks.p: The format of the image is specified using the extension of the file name. For example, if you specify "myfile.png", then the image will be saved in the PNG format. The following file extensions are recognized: .bmp, .gif, .jpg, .jpeg, .tiff, .emf.

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.Chart.Save(System.String,System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat)
member.summary: Creates the chart image and saves it to a file in the specified format.
member.param: The image file name with full path.
The format in which to save the image.

remarks.p: The following formats are supported: .bmp, .gif, .jpg, .jpeg, .tiff, .emf.

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.Chart.SaveToSwf(System.String)
member.overloads: Creates the chart drawing in the Macromedia Flash format and saves it.
member.summary: Creates the chart drawing in the Macromedia Flash format and saves it into a file.
member.param: The flash image filename with full path.

remarks.p: This method will store the image as a 32bit bitmap in the Flash file resulting in a larger file, but no loss of image quality.

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.Chart.SaveToSwf(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates the chart drawing in the Macromedia Flash format and saves it into a file.
member.param: The flash image filename with full path.
Specifies whether to compress the chart image.

remarks.p: When isJpegMode is true, the image will be compressed using JPEG compression in the Flash file resulting in a small file, but with some loss of image quality. When isJpegMode is false, the image will be stored as a 32bit bitmap in the Flash file resulting in a larger file, but no loss of image quality.

member.name: M:Aspose.Chart.Chart.SaveToSwf(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates the chart drawing in the Macromedia Flash format and saves it into a stream.
member.param: The output stream.

remarks.p: This method will store the image as a 32bit bitmap in the Flash file resulting in a larger file, but no loss of image quality.
